sentences: Britt Woodman (June 4, 1920 â€“ October 13, 2000) was an American jazz trombonist.
After service in World War II he played with Boyd Raeburn before joining with Lionel Hampton in 1946.
During the 1950s he worked with Ellington.

As a member of Ellington's band he can be heard on Such Sweet Thunder (1957), Ella Fitzgerald Sings the Duke Ellington Song Book (also 1957), Black, Brown, and Beige (1958) and Ellington Indigos (1958).
In the 1970s, he led his own octet and worked with pianist Toshiko Akiyoshi.
In 1989, he was in the personnel for the album Epitaph dedicated to the previously unrecorded music of Charles Mingus.
